title: Grade 2
subject: Extended Evidence Outcomes: Reading, Writing, Communicating (2020-)

EFA13038E0484DCF8BF2B3DD6D50473C.description:
Recall information from experiences or gathered information to answer
questions.

48910D79D62B4FAABC62B768AC4C3263.description: Form WH-questions on a provided research topic (e.g., who and what).

4CBC19813737499EBE9C415423813ABB.description: Use a variety of provided resources to answer questions of interest.

EC70EE7F6F794BC98B8FDDE0B6AE9027.description:
Locate text features (e.g., heading, bold type, illustrations) on a provided
resource.

76BF5E39A5154826BE42C2E06C9A315B.description:
Use a familiar, simple graphic organizer or familiar note taking strategy to
gather information from a provided source.

A2BBAD24F2F941B286230EFE69DC7753.description:
When seeking information, identify a variety of familiar resources (e.g.,
dictionary, internet, library database) that may contain the needed
information.

CE3B534104D4400EB7C89BCC0970B1CC.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (EE.W.2.7).

13ACA1CF48C042CD841F998446243486.description: With guidance and support students can:

D64833499241456885BCDDB564E1EDB0.description: Participate in shared research and inquiry, gathering information from a variety of resources to answer questions.

27B87752EF9A4F17A851D7EFB42A9FD8.description:
Use technology (including assistive technologies) to produce and publish
writing (EE.W.2.6).

B539CF4FF62A45459A22440D79B9D034.description:
Add more information to own drawing, dictation, or writing to strengthen
the message (EE.W.2.5).Â

154F82A8E9CF41F89F8578C67102D107.description:
Consult print in the environment to support reading and spelling
(EE.L.2.2e).

11618EAFF4FA47EB81D13B50F2F3D5C8.description:
Identify printed rhyming words with the same spelling pattern
(EE.L.2.2d).

60F42FADB59F4AD3B4707A71D159A8EE.description: Capitalize the first letter of familiar names (EE.L.2.2a).

C772A847C72E430DA39E3A897564DA68.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of conventions of standard English
(EE.L.2.2).

2615A6ED362049D4BF9F06B8589EE4FA.description: Combine two or more words together in communication (EE.L.2.1f).

7A8026EAF30C4A18ABE7F6524D0053FA.description:
Use frequently occurring pronouns to refer to self and others (e.g., we,
they, him, her, them) (EE.L.2.1c).

EA0636BD74744725A60715FB02688955.description:
Use common nouns (e.g., mom, dad, boy, girl) in communication
(EE.L.2.1b).

8F3DB0D3D82945309F3B07768A4CA43E.description: Demonstrate understanding of letter and word use (EE.L.2.1).

5F99BA84E8744321B77036D9E74A2C1E.description: With guidance and support students can:

927D8E2766DC4DC8B3FA459D393AD036.description:
Use a process to revise and edit so that thoughts and ideas are communicated clearly with appropriate spelling, capitalization, grammar,
and punctuation.

B4B7592ED88842F88932202E3167A60E.description: Describe actions, thoughts, or feelings of a character or event.

86807A8F3BDC4464BB4727C403EA2B88.description: Use teacher or peer feedback to improve narrative writing.

27DBE503DB3748B383709C3E5350922A.description: Create a phrase or sentence that includes a descriptive adjective or verb.

9D3BE0F035B4402E9A882100C41B896C.description: Communicate a conclusionary statement for a narrative story.

AA8D20B0645C4C928AE3AF67685313DA.description:
When creating a narrative use temporal words to signal event order (e.g.,
after, next, then) to signal sequence of events.

D14C22086A0340CC8323696E2164E972.description:
Select an event or personal experience and use drawing, writing, or
dictating to compose a message about it (EE.W.2.3).

668D171B3E2D4A4398EF68C94BC86BA3.description: With guidance and support students can:

38AA5AA070684664AF82151BA514646F.description: Write real or imagined narratives that describe events in sequence and provide a sense of closure.

6CFAE060730442E1A14656E3119AD800.description: Use technology to create a written statement (e.g., typing, AAC device).Â

BBE0DED9B1044FCDA6610571889F0DA7.description:
Use transitional words (e.g., first, then) when writing about a series of
events.

26BFD615251C45EE87BF38DFE7D89BEC.description:
Develop a simple outline with a main idea and at least one supporting
detail.

32C64D14C05D4B9081B87FBAF1B58AF1.description:
Sequence a familiar âhow-toâ (e.g., procedures, directions, recipes) that
follow a logical order and format.

F64D8E31573C44589C8A2599ACBB28E1.description: Develops and expresses a concluding statement.

5888D7E5011F4AEEA5F0F455C1AF4F57.description:
Select a topic and use drawing, dictating, or writing to compose a message
with one fact about the topic (EE.W.2.2).Â

4C2A2A58E1ED408CB8A423DC53D7619A.description: With guidance and support students can:

316B97588A3E49AA92C1605DB5C59DE9.description: Write informative/explanatory texts organized around main ideas which are supported by relevant details, facts, and definitions.

5CEC47C10FE343DBAA7274A67F176336.description: Communicates a conclusionary opinion statement about a book.

ECD4B81F2E81458EA3D63167BF5790D9.description: Use linking words (because, and, also) to connect opinion and reason.

B25AEC1F855B4014A07F5E50C2BF6709.description: Communicate an opinion about a book.

0481A1C16F084DE8BC459D1B1679C2CF.description: Select a book and provide an opinion about it (EE.W.2.1).

5D4EFEBB22D74F7EB17F4F5A9E2D00AA.description:

expressive communication modalities.

D35BA8AC6208436DA34146AB8A33073C.description: With guidance and support students can:

9AB86A6BB3F54202B3E7483EC4064BC2.description: Write pieces on a topic or book that state opinions and give supporting reasons.

6B4C399BC9B241DA83A816A7DDEEC55A.description: Apply a familiar strategy to decode multisyllabic words

0626BF3B1BE94D1DB0DCD32B8EE2A422.description:

78FEC5A9D40C4322961775486E0BDDCE.description:

(EE.L.2.5b).

0F7DBD8F4A8E40B7A1FF3A5305E8E7C7.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., happy:

7030040BE2954DDB9291140A9F27523F.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use (EE.L.2.5).

AA1974A791F240AC8E42B6FCD9F113BA.description: Identify the words comprising compound words (EE.L.2.4d).

A1418420F1AC400C8F06699A2B7F8EA3.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of new vocabulary drawn from reading and

16A0757D38334D2FB9FAEF060DF09EA4.description: Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating (EE.L.2.3).

ED73244F89D843C0B62EC38B622F3D5E.description: Read familiar text comprised of known words (EE.RF.2.4a).

E704686D63EF45D980AA58C51EA9A9DF.description:

4130A46B21EE4E9C9DFD1EFAD91E67F0.description: Identify the lower case letters of the alphabet (EE.RF.2.3a).

6B24474BCFAC430F87EF62AD993C36E8.description:
Demonstrate emerging use of letter-sound knowledge to read words
(EE.RF.2.3).

4D553B32CED84D1B93B1A99E11ED0B17.description: With guidance and support students can:

840AFC69BDA94A5F892B45F581777F2E.description: Apply knowledge of complex spelling patterns (orthography) and word meanings (morphology) to decode words with accuracy.

CD21C5A2C9174A82BABB4F07C6296BFE.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of informational text including history/SS,

6D847C40A0D443EBBAC1F64B76F07B12.description:
Identify a common element between the two texts on the same topic

48B4958A9A984AFF82FA92F6CC7E9508.description: Identify points the author makes in an informational text (EE.RI.2.8).

651739455262488195B790A690C0E436.description:

D10E6EF85EF0451A8022276DFFD245F8.description: Identify the role of the author and the illustrator (EE.RI.2.6).

D7D46A2AE57F4CEE915E6D16F4AE214B.description:
Identify details in informational text or its graphic representations

B60B813D0C2443CB8164C8FA1E4726EF.description: Identify words related to a topic of a text (EE.RI.2.4).

995313FA42C74DDC9FFC7DEB138586BC.description:

48B68359414D4FACA022A08AE3A504F0.description: Identify the topic of the text (EE.RI.2.2).

EB525459D9494256A978CACE442468CE.description:
Answer who and what questions to demonstrate understanding of details in
a familiar text (EE.RI.2.1).

24BD23C732654D25A962396554AB0FE3.description: With guidance and support students can:

77D4F45404E94BEEA348E9670BE7C0FE.description: Apply specific skills to comprehend and fluently read informational texts.Â

5B8F15FC4C9C45A0A1621954D6162652.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of stories and poetry for clearly stated
purposes (EE.RL.2.10).

0DA238901C004F9BA47ECEFB0EE29A25.description: Identify similarities between two episodes in a story (EE.RL.2.9).

3427E964967842EC98844C7E999C36AA.description:

91A6EBDB43AB4D759DB0BAAEB7104CBF.description: Identify the speakers in a dialogue (EE.RL.2.6).

67579D0125D14FDFA5F9DF0FFF58A4E3.description:

2B4582B280A744D48DA8BF0293965219.description:

4CE2B637DB564358A935E1C90183FAC7.description: Apply specific skills to comprehend and fluently read literary texts.

E0964EC623C643958092A26CA299C7A5.description:
Select visual, audio, or tactual representations to depict a personal

C16087F3880F4D1C83DA55AD11884791.description:
Express ideas, thoughts, experiences or facts about familiar people, places,

DEAB4FE2384248F6B219BC324D1FEF9E.description:
Express an idea, feeling, or thought about a provided topic within a

473C3149349C46D2A9379C8DAEC3D6BE.description:

0B447694468348E48EDA8D91A31AE88C.description: With guidance and support students can:

0D0778BB5D4B4AFDAD72C396BEAFDEEA.description: Deliver presentations while maintaining focus on topic and be prepared to discuss.

7884BE7CCD254CD6A25B7BC9A21135F2.description: Answer questions about the details provided by the speaker (EE.SL.2.3).

5D25BC37249F473E808D8A2978F443B4.description:

DAF7BFE2C1FB473AA5FBE0C7D2B5A8B5.description:
